front.title: Usage of TRIP in Gateways for Exporting Phone Routes

abstract.t: This document describes a new application of the Telephony Routingover IP (TRIP) protocol. TRIP was engineered as a tool for inter-domain exchange of telephone routing information. However, it canalso be used as a means for gateways and soft switches to exporttheir routing information to a Location Server (LS), which may beco-resident with a proxy or gatekeeper. This LS can then manage thosegateway resources. We discuss the motivations for this application,and then show how a subset of TRIP is needed for this application.
